text:
Appropriation (Supplementary Appropriation for 2023-24) Act 2023

An Act for the appropriation of $40 491 000 out of the Public Account for the services of the Government for the financial year ending on 30 June 2024
[Royal Assent 2 November 2023]

Be it enacted by Her Excellency the Governor of Tasmania, by and with the advice and consent of the Legislative Council and House of Assembly, in Parliament assembled, as follows:

1. Short title
    This Act may be cited as the Appropriation (Supplementary Appropriation for 2023-24) Act 2023 .

2. Commencement
    This Act is taken to have commenced on 1 July 2023.

3. Interpretation
    For the purposes of this Act –
        Capital Services means –
                (a) public works or property required for public purposes; or
                (b) a loan authorised by law;
        Operating Services means the ordinary annual services of the Government.

4. Issue, application and appropriation of $40 491 000
        (1) In respect of the financial year ending on 30 June 2024, the Treasurer may –
                (a) issue the sum of $40 491 000 out of the Public Account; and
                (b) apply that sum for the services of the Government.
        (2) The sum specified in subsection (1)(a) is appropriated.

5. Purposes of appropriation
    The sum specified in section 4(1)(a) is to be applied for the purposes referred to in Schedule 1 and detailed in either of the following:
            (a) the agency information in support of the estimates for the financial year ending on 30 June 2024;
            (b) the information tabled by the Minister in support of Schedule 1 .

6. Expiry of Act
    This Act expires on 30 June 2025.

SCHEDULE 1 - Purposes of Supplementary Appropriation 2023-24

Section 5
